alert.note: Alert for Kingman (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 5:43PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Kingman County through 630 PM CDT... At 543 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Nashville, or 8 miles southeast of Isabel, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kingman, Nashville, Murdock, Waterloo, Willowdale, Zenda, Spivey, Cleveland, Mt Vernon, Kingman Airport, Rago, Cheney Lake and Cheney State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for south central Kansas.
